intro: Astracantha parrowiana, commonly known as the parrow's thorn, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces spiny, cylindrical fruits that contain seeds, aiding in its dispersal. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its unique morphology and ecological adaptations make it a notable species in its native habitat.
